structure.unit: STATE UNIVERSITIES AND COLLEGES -- REGIONAL EDUCATION -- ARCHAEOLOGY

law.text:
The General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky finds and declares that:
The economic future of the Commonwealth and the prosperity of its citizens depend on the ability of Kentucky businesses to compete effectively in the world economy;
A well-educated and highly trained workforce provides businesses in the Commonwealth with the competitive edge critical for their success; and
Too many adult Kentuckians are not full participants in the labor pool because they lack a high school diploma, its equivalent, or the workplace knowledge necessary to assure self-sufficiency for themselves and their families.
law.history: Repealed and reenacted 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 211, sec. 167, effective July 12, 2006. -- Created 1994 Ky. Acts ch. 487, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1994.
